div.l: To sauen his estat and yomanrie
And she was proude and pert as is a pye
A full faire siȝt was it vpon hem two
On halidayes beforn̄ her wolde he goo
With his tipett wounde aboute his heed
And she came aftir in a gite of reed
And symkyn had hosen of the same
Ther dorst no wiȝt clepen her but dame
Was non so hardy that went by the wey
That wᵗith her dorst rage or ones pley
But if he wolde be slayn of Symkyn
With panade or with knif or boidekyn
For ielouse folk be ꝑperlous euer moo
Algate thei wolde her wyues wenden soo
And eke she was somdell smoterlich
She was as digne as water in a dich
As full of hoker and of bismare
Hir thouȝt that a lady shuld her spare
What for hir kynred and hir nortilrye
That she had lerned in the Nonnerye
A douȝter had they betwix hem two
of xxᵗʸ yere withoute any moo
Sauyng a child that was of half yere age
In cradell it lay and was a propir page
This wenche thikke and wel I growen̄ was
With cāmmoys nose and yen grey as glas
With buttokkes brode with brestes rounde and hye
But riȝt faire was hir heer I will not lye
The ꝑperson of the toun̄ for she was so faire
In purpos was to maken hir his heyre
Bothe of his catell and his mesuage
And straunge he made it of hir mariage
His purpose was for to bistowe her hye
In to som worthi blode of Auncestrye
